intro: Isolepis chlorostachya, commonly known as green-stalked spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland environments in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features cylindrical, grass-like stems that are typically green to bluish-green in color, distinguishing it from other rush species. Its inflorescence consists of dense, spike-like clusters of small, three-ranked flowers. Isolepis chlorostachya thrives in moist soils and is often found in marshes, pond edges, and other aquatic or semi-aquatic habitats.
